intro: Acmella leptophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf false poinsettia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, showy bracts that resemble petals. The plant typically grows in wet, tropical environments and has a compact, bushy growth habit. Its flowers are usually inconspicuous and are surrounded by brightly colored leaves that serve as attractants for pollinators. Acmella leptophylla is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant foliage.
